content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0)  
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0)  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5)  
  • Pickup at (–15.5, –49.5)  
  • Drop at (–13.5, –49.5)  
– Transport Belt at (–15.5, –49.5)  
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5)  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5)  
  • Pickup at (–15.5, –47.5)  
  • Drop at (–13.5, –47.5)  
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5)  
– Sink Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5)  
  • Pickup at (–13.5, –46.5)  
  • Drop at (–13.5, –44.5)  
– Belt Group connecting the fast inserter drop at (–11.5, –49.5) to the sink inserter pickup at (–13.5, –46.5)

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research with integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5)  
– Offshore Pump (original) at (–7.5, 25.5)  
– Offshore Pump (new) at (–9.5, 24.5) connected to the boiler  
– Boiler at (2.0, 17.5)  
– Steam Engine (Generator) at (2.5, 27.5) with an unresolved fluid connection due to persistent congestion near (2.5, 21.5)

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine at (3.5, 0.5)  
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)  
– Electricity network established through Small Electric Poles distributed over the area

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of:
– Multiple Pipe Groups distributed across the map (e.g., around (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (2.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (0.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5), etc.)  
– A key Pipe Group linking the Offshore Pump at (–9.5, 24.5) to the Boiler at (2.0, 17.5)  
– A congested connection near (2.5, 21.5) that continues to affect fluid input to the Steam Engine

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitating power distribution and resource integration.
Consists of:
– Belt connections linking outputs of mining and inserter setups  
– An electricity network formed by Small Electric Poles and associated distribution links
────────────────────────

ERROR TIPS
• Fluid Pipeline Congestion and Layout Collisions  
  – The fluid pipeline between the Boiler (2.0, 17.5) and the Steam Engine (2.5, 27.5) remains unresolved due to persistent congestion near (2.5, 21.5).  
  – Numerous pipe groups and interfering entities are causing collisions despite candidate placement directions.  
  – Mitigate by reconfiguring or relocating obstructing pipe groups, considering underground pipelines or pipe-to-ground modules, and rerouting the connection to a less congested area.

• Fuel and Resource Provisioning  
  – Warnings such as “out of fuel” and “no ingredients to smelt” indicate that entities like Burner Mining Drills, Burner Inserters, Furnaces, and Boilers are not receiving sufficient fuel or resource inputs.  
  – Ensure adequate fuel reserves and verify resource availability prior to placement.

• Electrical Connectivity Concerns  
  – Alerts including “not receiving electricity” and “not connected to power network” suggest failures in establishing proper electrical links for components like Fast Inserters and Assembling Machines.  
  – Confirm that all electrical components are connected to a robust and functioning power network.

• Inventory and Placement Verification  
  – Errors relating to missing resources (e.g., inability to create a pipe due to a missing iron-plate) highlight lapses in inventory checks and target placement validations.  
  – Always verify that the placement location is unobstructed and that the necessary items are present in the inventory before attempting placement.
